content.text: This was not identified in the recent PEN test.
The risk is raw HTML passed in the param of
tg_flash
that is rendered in the browser.  If the param were encoded, an attacker would not be able to inject alternative HTML in to the user experience.
Rather than seeing something like:

?tg_flash=%3Cp%3EWe%27re+connecting+to+our+exam+delivery+partner--sometimes+this+takes+a+little+time.+Reloading+this+page+may+help.+%3C%2Fp%3E%0A%0A%3Cp%3E%3Ca+class%3D%22btn-link%22+style%3D%22color%3A%23337ab7%3B%22+href%3D%22https%3A%2F%2Fapple.useclarus.com%2Fpearson_vue%2Fsso%22%3EAlternatively+you+may+continue+at+Pearson+VUE.%3C%2Fa%3E%3C%2Fp%3E
we could render a language token like this:
?tg_flash=LT_12342321
or an encoded string like this (if we want to skip the language token management):

?tg_flash="b'gAAAAABhFS1fFnmNAj1Hrnb63LOJEXkC-6VdqV1VYVfCx-7iMDZo1aPU5Tp0TOnsjY9TtEJRUT2eM5Ya04ChiUv6LvyVtG31E77bjsVBfDdao7Bj5FE7-mq1efnywptpvq3L9b-TO_XSoZATbo7gjW1dNe-oHZKE5zubHlwvuBVw_qVmq32zcaBRYioekwf2L9SPNtce6TUa-1VrQqYLYsUrNpstXyTdWokqt3LFBOaS52PdQXYcwqW-sZkZ4TYJKZ99THBpHYuJqSPk73k_c5LPp_1OLEqlRqEqZ7l5710ENfMb9GOwLD6ab91Hfe0z_ndRO07SVM9WYC5u7uajsSAjaE7UUWGjTcZZGb7jh1v_QwpJLBwZZ75cGsTUVC7FC-wcUfJdCwavPAlz-ZxqhSmjttPeSZvGbN23QXIG_6Aqwch2FA0Uf9WpIB4eTJGqdEdXypxzkhCyrG60t_CumUp1q0p04PgXPAzzR4InhNMg97_jlxDcRk3jtW45SoqTGr1mkB8xzsd8dpAHbLgrkn5T7V8vHPCX1w=='"
The above is encrypted in python w/ Fernet from

nonEditableReason.message: An issue at the top of the hierarchy cannot have a parent set.

content.text: There appears to be a reflected XSS vulnerability in the website
apple.useclarus.com
The Apple Infosec team was reviewing this site
and from the schedule exam option, was redirected to
https://apple.useclarus.com/credentials/browse/
PoC
1- Go to
2- Go to Schedule Exam.
3- You are being redirected to
https://apple.useclarus.com/credentials/browse/
4- Login with your account and go to
https://apple.useclarus.com/apply/application?id=366
5- There is an error displaying, and at this domain
https://apple.useclarus.com/dashboard/?tg_flash=
, there is some HTML code that is showing.
6- Add any payload there, and it is being reflected.

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.

content.text: Need engineering assistance to determine why, for a particular candidate in production, the CE is blocked by whether exists a “certification” or not.
Candidate Susan Tanner (173966)

nonEditableReason.message: An issue at the top of the hierarchy cannot have a parent set.

content.text: except the CERPs portfolio is showing the following message:
“You must have at least one current certification in order to obtain Continuing Education credits.”
Since the candidate has a current certification, it seems like this is incorrect. Can you look into it?
Thanks! Lesley

fields.summary: Question:  Bulk change of Credential Expiration Dates

status.description: Converted to some SOW type of issue
status.name: Converted

content.text: NBPTS to provide list of candidates to update. Project is blocked until this list is received.
I think from a product standpoint we would want to the APIs to allow for this, and allow for a dynamic tool to be built for it, but I think there might be a couple gaps.

I think this “first” time at least is a project (estimated 2pts), and we probably will just do it via the database for expediency, but I think we should use it as a requirement gathering exercise so we can figure out what we need to ask for as far as Clarity enhancements.

nonEditableReason.message: An issue at the top of the hierarchy cannot have a parent set.

content.text: With deferrals, we need to extend expiration dates for a subset of candidates with credentials (approx. 2000+).
